ca.uqac.lif.petitpoucet.function

Class AtomicFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.dag.Node
      • ca.uqac.lif.petitpoucet.function.AtomicFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connectable, Contextualizable, ExplanationQueryable, Function, Queryable, Duplicable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbsoluteValue, Addition, BooleanConnective, Constant, Filter, Fork, IfThenElse, IsGreaterThan, Multiplication, Not, NumberCast, Split, Subtraction, VectorFunction

    public abstract class AtomicFunction
extends Node
implements Function, Duplicable, ExplanationQueryable
    A self-contained computation unit that produces an array of output values from an array of input values. This class is abstract, and must minimally implement method getValue() to become concrete.

    The class also implements the ExplanationQueryable interface by providing a boilerplate explanation where all elements of the output are related to all elements of the input. Only functions that explain their output differently need to override this method.

      • m_context

        protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> m_context
        A context that can be assigned to a function.

      • m_inputPins

        protected AtomicFunction.AtomicFunctionInputPin[] m_inputPins
        An array of input pins for the function. The size of the array corresponds to the function's input arity.

      • m_outputPins

        protected AtomicFunction.AtomicFunctionOutputPin[] m_outputPins
        An array of output pins for the function. The size of the array corresponds to the function's output arity.

      • getExplanation

        public final PartNode getExplanation(Part part)
        Description copied from interface: ExplanationQueryable
        Produces an explanation graph for a given part. The method creates a new node factory by itself.
        Specified by:
        getExplanation in interface ExplanationQueryable
        Parameters:
        part - The part used as the starting point of the explanation
        Returns:
        A node corresponding to the root of the resulting explanation graph. The root of this graph is always a PartNode with part as its part, and the callee as the subject. Other nodes may or may not be attached to this root, depending on the subject and the explanation.

      • getExplanation

        public PartNode getExplanation(Part part,
                               NodeFactory factory)
        Description copied from interface: ExplanationQueryable
        Produces an explanation graph for a given part, using nodes provided by a given factory.
        Specified by:
        getExplanation in interface ExplanationQueryable
        Parameters:
        part - The part used as the starting point of the explanation
        factory - The factory that provides nodes
        Returns:
        A node corresponding to the root of the resulting explanation graph. The root of this graph is always a PartNode with part as its part, and the callee as the subject. Other nodes may or may not be attached to this root, depending on the subject and the explanation.

      • getValue

        protected abstract java.lang.Object[] getValue(java.lang.Object... inputs)
                                        throws InvalidNumberOfArgumentsException
        Computes the output value of the function based on input arguments.
        Parameters:
        inputs - The input arguments.
        Returns:
        An array corresponding to the output values of the function. The size of this array is equal to the output arity of the function.
        Throws:
        InvalidNumberOfArgumentsException - If the number of arguments of the method does not equal the input arity of the function
